product_overview: SNS Clocked In v2 Frontend is a comprehensive Flutter-based employee time tracking and management system designed for multi-tenant environments. It offers feature-rich dashboards for admins and employees, seamless authentication, detailed attendance, leave and timesheet tracking, profile and notification management, and advanced admin/super admin capabilities with a unified design system and modern architecture.
core_goals: Provide an intuitive and responsive UI for managing employee time tracking, attendance, leave, and timesheets.
Support multi-tenant access with company selection and tailored dashboards for admin, employee, and super admin roles.
Ensure robust authentication flow and onboarding experience for first-time users with smooth app bootstrap and routing.
Implement a scalable and maintainable feature-first Flutter architecture with Provider state management and go_router navigation.
Deliver a consistent design system with reusable UI components and adherence to best UI/UX practices including accessibility and responsiveness.
Ensure high-quality code through comprehensive widget testing covering all key screens, filters, and role-specific views.
key_features: App bootstrap with routing and shell navigation including splash, onboarding, and home screens.
Authentication and user login UI with secure session and router guards.
Multi-tenant company selection screen to support different companies per user.
Role-specific dashboards: Admin dashboard with reports, employee management, attendance overview, and settings; Employee dashboard focused on personal attendance, timesheets, leave, and profile.
Attendance management including break types administration and daily timeline tracking.
Leave management with request submission, approval workflows, balances, and history tracking.
Timesheet submission by employees and admin approval workflows.
Time tracking feature with time entry logging and persistence.
Comprehensive employee management for admins including filtering and search capabilities.
Notifications system with status tracking (read/unread) and role-based filters.
User profile management for viewing and editing personal data.
Company calendar integration with month view and admin controls.
Super admin level management for system-wide configuration including companies, users, and system reports.
Centralized design system with consistent colors, typography, spacing, and reusable components like stat cards, buttons, filters, and empty or error states.
Responsive design adapting layout for mobile, tablet, and desktop breakpoints.
Accessibility compliance with semantic labeling, tooltips, and color contrast standards.
Debug tools and a component showcase for UI development and testing.
user_flow_summary: User launches the app: splash screen shows while bootstrap processes run.
New users guided through onboarding flow before login.
User logs in via authentication screen, with validation and error handling.
Upon login, user selects company if applicable for multi-tenant environment.
User navigates to role-specific dashboard: Admin or Employee shell with bottom navigation tabs.
Admin can access quick stats, reports, attendance, employee management, break types, leave approvals, and company calendar via dashboard.
Employee can track attendance, submit timesheets, apply for leave, and view notifications and profile.
Users receive and manage notifications with ability to mark all as read and filter by scope.
Admin and super admin roles access advanced system management screens for companies, users, and system reports.
Users utilize collapsible filters sections to refine displayed data in lists and reports.
Throughout, UI states are managed with loading skeletons, empty states, and error states with retry options.
Quick stats section is persistently visible at top for key screens for immediate data glance.
validation_criteria: All screens have comprehensive widget tests verifying UI structure, data display, role-specific content, and state handling (loading, empty, error).
Quick stats sections are always visible and display correct data across roles and screens.
Collapsible filters function correctly, default expanded, toggleable, hiding controls when collapsed.
No visual layout issues such as overflow errors or component clipping in tested scenarios.
Role-specific views correctly filter and present data according to user roles (admin, employee, super admin).
Search and filtering interactions yield correct subsets of data when used.
Authentication flow correctly redirects and guards routes as designed.
Responsive layouts adapt correctly on mobile, tablet, and desktop resolutions.
Accessibility requirements are met including semantic labels, tooltips, touch target sizes, and color contrast.
Reusable design system components conform to standards and appear consistent in all screens.
Debug and component showcase screens function properly and aid in UI verification.
Tests cover all enhanced Phase 1 screens with clear pass status in CI runs.
